Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, children, now that I have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, for the completion of which I have labored to its end, and through its explanations and declarations, it is clear to me that I have composed this treatise for you, which pertains to my surgical operations.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For our operation of the hand is practiced in our region and in our times as almost entirely private, although it is a science greatly needed, and its practice has been obscured; and only some minor descriptions remain in the books of the Ancients, which they modified to correct errors and hesitations that have closed off understanding of it and weakened its force and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is evident to me that I should revitalize that part of this treatise in accordance with the way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and for the sake of adding the forms of the cautery tools and other instruments of the work, which serves as an addition to the declaration and preparation thereof, a necessary cause for this.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	More the cause why a good craftsman does not apply his hand well in our time is that the art of medicine is long and that its practitioner must be trained in the science of anatomy which Galen knew well enough to understand the youth of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and had knowledge of the bones, the nerves, and the arteries, their number and their diseases; and of the pulsating and quiet veins, and of their places.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this Hippocrates says that in name is little, but more in the work and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	More we have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for who does not know what we have said about anatomy will not be free from error due to which many men will die, as I have seen too many of them. For some are formed in this science and proceed from that same science and its experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a physician who, being foolish and ignorant, incurred an apostematia scropholosa in the neck of a woman, and injured some arteries so that great blood flowed out, causing the woman to die among convulsions.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And there was another doctor who almost drained a stone from a man who had suffered in his condition, and the stone was large, and brought it to him and dried that stone with a piece of the bladder, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called for the extraction of that, and I see that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient upon him, he will die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And there was another doctor who took payment from a duke of our land for surgery, and he arrived at a blacksmith who had suffered a fracture in his thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and splints of strong structure, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then the dislocation according to his desires, and then the rejoining, and then the letting it rest for several days, commanding us to loosen the bandage; and we stayed like this until the thigh and foot recovered, and proceeded to our detriment.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to dislodge the stone, and peace and attempt to alleviate his pains was achieved.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But however, corruption was confirmed in the member, because I could not restrain that, and did not cease to walk the corruption in the member while the illness persisted.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who incised an oncotic abscess, and it became ulcerated over several days, during which the evil increased in it with the lord of it.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the disease is purely of melancholic humor, and does not reach everywhere, but affects only the member that suffers from everything being hostile to it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is necessary for you that the operation be devised in two divisions: one where the operation is associated with health, and another where the work is perilous in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed here in all parts of this book where the operation is filled with error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard this and leave that, so that the leaves do not find a way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your weapons with diligence and protection of God, and your patients with felicity and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God seeking salvation and laudable success, and lay aside the terrible illnesses difficult to cure, and let your weapons be of what fears you, so that sitting in your faith and in your name you are not deceived: for more remains to your glory, and rather in this world and after in your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Galia already has been dissected in some surgical texts:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat illness falsely, so that bad doctors will not be named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you should now have dedicated this treatise according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the treatise, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered of the foot, concerning the forms of the instruments and the tools of the cautery, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and puncturing, and on cups, and on blisters, and on the extraction of arrows and similar things, all categorized and ordered by the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of sprains and similar conditions; a chapter ordered by the head between the feet, and by the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On the cautery with fire and with sharp medicine, and recall of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that, the treatment of the entire book begins.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Know what I will say about the quality of the coals of that cautery and its effects, and in which conditions the use of a cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the cautery coals and its effects is long and prolix, subtle by science, and hidden in secret; much has already been said about it by wise men, and they are divided in their opinions. It suffices me to touch on a little of their sermons, fearing length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore say that a cautery is applied to all compositions universally which are of flesh or sinew, except two compositions, which are compositions of sinew.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the sinewy and dry composition, the flesh will desiccate; for some said that a cautery is beneficial for that, while others said the opposite, that a cautery is not appropriate in malaise which is due to quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inappropriate that such malaise, being sinewy and dry, be healed by that which is cautery and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And say that those who say the opposite, that by cautery one is cured in all sinewy and dry malaise that comes in men's bodies, for when you compare man's body and its humors to the composition of fire, you find man's body humid.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to the saying of that, which I have already experienced many times myself.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I do not consider that it comes to those who have been extensively trained in the Capitol of Cauterization by long practice, and who know the diversity of human composition and the disposition of maladies in their varieties, and the causes of those, and the accidents related to them, as well as the duration of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complications, it is not about fear, and especially in wet diseases, for all doctors agree on those, and are not divided in using cautery in them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Understand, sons, that the secret of curing by cautery with fire and its goodness lies in the burning medicine, for fire is simple, its action reaching only the member being cauterezed and not affecting other members much except with slight harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of the burning medicine reaches that member from which it is distant, and strongly causes in the affected member a disease difficult to heal and quickly makes it worse.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not cause anything other than to superfluously consume. And we are already familiar with this through experience and long service in studying the art concerning the truth of causes; and for this reason, I excuse myself for the length of my discourse. If it were not that this is not written at liberty in this pause, and that you secretly hide your knowledge about fire, and the quality of its operation on bodies and its expulsion through which you expel diseases, then this discourse would be a philosophical demonstration, which would benefit your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree about the time at which it is convenient to make a cautery and when the best season is spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that a cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage from the accidental season is submerged in the youth of what is burnt by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fistulas, which do not suffer delay because it is feared of those that come evil intentions, which are greater than minor damage entering through the season.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus they do not place a cautery on your feet, or, sons, they only consider the common people and the unskilled physicians, for they believe that the ailment that is cured by a cautery is not effective at all times, and they avoid such a consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not that they care for this, for a cautery is nothing more in medicine than a means to alter the composition and dry the humors which are the cause of the venous pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nonetheless, a cautery can be superfluous in medicine for the sake of the speed of its efficacy and the virtue of its operation and the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that their illness returns at some point in time, according to the complexity of the disease and the location of their illness, as well as their virtue, and what is prepared in their body through the aggregation of superfluities within them, and what is acquired by them in food and semblance of those causes; but the illness in which a cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a limb with few superfluities and humidities, just as a tooth cautery for pain and similar to that, it is possible that such pain does not return, more so when this is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	It is more common to say that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a surgeon's saying, not what I understand by it, for I believe it is not a cure that benefits either medicine or any other cause except the cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to this; and I understand that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine only when one administers the methods of cure in some illnesses, and those medicines do not work, and near the end of the treatment, one administers a cautery, which then benefits that condition.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And at this point, the last remedy of medicine is the cautery, not according to the understanding which I understand the vulgar and too many of the foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that a cautery made of gold is better than one made of iron, and they did not say this only because of the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for a cautery does not burn, since it is not absolutely heated, for I have already tested this and found that it does not heat all bodies equally, and a gold cautery is good and better than one made of iron as they say; but when you make a cautery with fire on gold, it is indeed so, for the gold ignites according to the quantity you want due to the corrosion of the gold, and prepares to receive fire; and if you adjust over this ignition, the gold melts by the fire, and settles in the fire with some sheets so that the craftsman can cut through its occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, when making a cautery of iron, you should use it more lightly and more properly according to the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter concerning the cautery according to other chapters, and I have ordered those of the foot within, so that I delay the one requesting what they want from me.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for headache due to cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery treats cold and humidity over the servant accident of which there are two causes, causing soda and much traumatic flux, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the hollows and the ears flowing, and much drowsiness, and tooth pain, and the gullet, and universally all illness that comes through coldness, thus as paralytically, soda and apoplexy, and similarities in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first, I command the patient to be evacuated with a laxative medicine on an empty stomach for three or four nights, according to the power of the illness and the age of the patient and their habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and place that razor between your hands on a leaning bench so that he places his hands on his own foot.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the razor from your palm near his mouth between his palms.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More over, since the correct location has been determined, mark that location with a probe, and then heat the olive cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that cautery over the marked location with a probe, in such a way that it descends gradually, and your hand is gradually constrained, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and look at the location. If you see any part of the bone being revealed through the flesh, as much as an err (a small amount), then lift your hand. If not, return your hand to that iron or another, if it is cooled, so that what I have said about it can be seen on the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little of salt, dissolve it in that [solution], and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place it on the wound in the groin and leave it there until the scar of the burn is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with an ointment of tetrafarmakon until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they also say that when the wound is opened wide, it heals better, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the knee should be cauterized inside the bone, and that the cautery should remain until part of the bone tissue is burnt.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape what is attached to the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the marrow, pressing firmly on the bone until the bone cools, and this is the method of Alphécat:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate from that place exhale the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be kept open for a long time, and then cure it before it becomes consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two types of cautery for all, except in some men according to a way of fear; and leave that one, my advice is, it is better to be healed when possible; because the head is developed by solution of continuity of the skull as we have testified in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of foul nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is more safe and better, my advice; use that one and do that work for healing.
Capitol segon.	Capitulum secundum.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the cautery for the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs in the head, and this has been prolonged in the patient, and they use various treatments such as powders, seeds, cap purge, plasters, poultices, cats, bandages, and similar remedies, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery which does not improve the condition for any of these causes, consider whether the head of the patient is of strong constitution in its nature; and there is no foul or great cold, then this cautery should be reconsidered. Leave that one for another cautery and use it only slightly.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that on the top of his head between where the vein is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the vein and the quantity of the opening as we have counted, and cauterize that with a cautery at the back of the head in the place where it is called vas, — and this is the place where suction is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand here, and do not uncover the head, for the patient finds great pain from this different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will say this cauterization in its place, for know that the cauterization with which one cauterizes the horns of the head and the occiput is a finer cauterization than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Head complete.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cauterization for new migraine.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is a sharp pain in the back of the head, or a prolonged pain in the temples, medicinals should be applied to the head to relieve it, and another treatment, which I have described for diseases, should be administered. If this does not help, then cauterization can be performed in two ways: with a burning acute medicinal substance, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May a cautery that burns in medicine be that you take a piece of aloes, and soak it there and bind the extremities of it from both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then apply the spot of pain on the temple with a lancet laid gently there and make the cut where it is to be hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then strengthen the place where it is stopped by descent compression, and leave it for the space of three hours; and then remove and cut the aloes, and leave the wound for two or three days, and then cover over the spot submerge in balsam until the area heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that wound with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, use those wounds which some medicines burn, the ones I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cautery be performed in this manner: heat it with fire, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a key lock, because the head of it has the form of a clove and in the middle location there is a small projection.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place your hand over the location of the pain, and hold it back—so that the artery which is left is not burned—and slowly rotate the small iron bit.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount that is burned due to the strength of the cauterization is as much as its size, lift your hand so that the artery which is left is not burned, so that there be no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then immerse it in salt water and place it over the area, leaving it for three days. Then place it near a warm place, and apply ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you do, cauterize at the tip of the knife edge according to the cautery, and guard against cutting the artery in this new migraine.
Capitol quart.	Capitulum quartum.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery treatment for old headache.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure a headache as we have said in the previous treatment and as we have said in the divisions of diseases, and if the treatment is not effective for the disease that does not respond to what we have said about the first cautery or the cautery by fire, then you must heat the surgical cautery until it becomes white-hot. Place your line over the site of the pain along its length, or where it may be. Then hold your hand for a moment and strongly apply the heated cautery to penetrate into the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, you must be careful with the continuity of the jaw, which is affected by chewing, and ensure that the tendon is not adhered and the nerve which supplies it is intact, to prevent spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the care and precaution of the flow of blood in the artery that is amputated, for in its amputation there is fear, especially for one who does not know what to do and is not studious and hesitates; and leaves the operation at its beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will recall the treatment for the flow of blood事故，根据其方式，在此自由之地的相应位置。
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this illness in someone who does not tolerate this cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, apply the cautery in the middle of the foot as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you see, apply the cautery which we have said in the chapter on the strengthening of the artery with two knives, and this is a better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is treated with hot applications, and another treatment as I have said in the division does not relieve the pain, then apply the cautery, which is called puncta. This is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then puncture near the beginning, and extend it to the vicinity of the whole ear as if a wheel is turned, or in the circuit of each place if the pain is in any part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Lengthen the cautery from the rim of the ear gradually placing it where you have tested the location.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery with ten points around the entire ear, and cool it, then quickly cure the places between as they heal.
Capitol .vi.	Capitol. vi.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cautery for the tortura.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tortura which is cured and treated with cautery is none other than due to the species that the vein carries, as we have said in the divisions of ailments.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cautery for the species that flows due to dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that species of tortura with jerras, capipurgi, and guarismes, and your cure does not agree, then when you cauterize the maladie, you should make three cauteries: the first on the rim of the ear, the second a small one in its temple, and the third on the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, for softening effect occurs only in the part that is healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cautery is to apply the cautery on the outer side of the ear near the tip of the ear, placing a small piece of cloth over the top of the head. On the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the affected part, and then place your hand with the cautery within until the quantity of the material of the codena is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the method of the cautery, and it is specific to the barber-surgeon, whose form is given below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, more subtle is that you should add just a little as you see fit; and cut away a small amount to avoid unnecessary crudity.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then cover the area with what is given and proceed to treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cautery treatment for old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you have cured it as we said before, and there is no fever in the patient, then cauterize that area with four cauteries: over all the horns of its head; and with a cautery on the middle part of the head, as we said; and with a cautery on the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The method of cauterization is done as described above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the opening of the stomach; and it is more towards the rear; and then it is cured as you proceed.
Capitol .viii.	Capitol. viii.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization for oblivion through flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Cover what is given to the patient at the beginning with large stones and pills of the service purgative.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then wrap the head of the patient entirely with plaster and place it on the neck as described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And pause that for some beats, as that is a way of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the method and order which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And therefore, if these good methods help; and if not, then make three cautery marks on the rear part of his head, which should be descending from the upper part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And pause the duration of a finger's breadth between each cautery, and proceed with the cautery as previously instructed.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you add more oil and the patient can tolerate it, then make the cautery in the middle location; and if you add a greater amount, then cautery that area above the two horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	And proceed with the cautery while it is healing; and let the cautery be in the shape as shown previously.
Capitol .ix.	Capitulum ix.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cautery of piles and the soothing of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col. E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma. E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then cure that where it is healed, and this be an olive cautery.
Capitol .x.	Capitulum.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cautery treatment for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	No is it cauterized the epileptic, but only if the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore modify the patient's pulse at the beginning of his artery and the other cure which we have mentioned in the division when the illness is great and resists the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate the medicines, then for several days beforehand, the assistant modifies their diet and administers guar gums and masticators.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then over the head of the patient, and then cauterize that spot on the middle part of the head according to the preceding method, and another cauterization on the occiput, and over each horn of the head he cauterizes.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the illness is strong and resists, then cauterize those spots as I have said, while maintaining paralysis and softening of the body around the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use olive oil cauterization as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then use a subtle cauterization according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Capitol xi.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cautery for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humors and large flames, then use the cautery as we have said in the chapter on paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess moisture declining into melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then have him drink what purifies his brain according to what was mentioned in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then place your hand on the patient's head, and properly make a torcortura (a circular incision) on it above the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be bathed and kept from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; it is most worthy of being used as a remedy for sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat it over the fire for a moderate warming, which the patient can bear when it is more intense.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place something in the middle of his head in the circle, and let it be fumigated.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient every week once, and follow the other regimen until it is healed; or if you wish, make a cautery there by making small points according to its size. Otherwise, keep your hand on an ordered cautery: this is a type of cautery which moistens the brain in equal measure.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cauterized area on the edge or in the folds of cloth.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cautery for water descending into the heel.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When the beginning of water in the heel has been declared by the signs which I have said in the division, then begin and give to drink to the patient what modifies the humor, and keep that free from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let that sugar be immersed in wine for several days.

And then command him to raise his head, and cautery that point in the middle of the head with a pointed cautery; and cautery that point with two cauteries on the temples if it is the beginning of scalding water in both hands, or of one burn if it is the beginning of water in one hand.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Apply the cautery to all veins and arteries which are left without a seal; and let the cauteries be in that length along the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And guard against fluxes of blood when it is cauteryed; and if you see fluxes of blood, apply some medicine which is within your reach.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will bring with me wisdom which is in the extraction of arteries and in their ligation, and caution against fluxes of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes the neck is cauteryed leaving two bones with cauteries deeply produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cautery of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the eyes are ancient and through the veins and arteries which are in the manifest place of the head above, it is verified that this is excess phlegmatic fluid, then cauteryize that with a cautery as we have recounted in the chapter of the beginning of flowing water in the feet, and cauteryize in the middle of the head and two cauteries on the neck leave two temples, and two cauteries on the neck leave two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you suffer from addition, then cauteryize that on the entire length of the vein in the eye at the outer corner of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cautery for the foulness of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When your treatment for what we have said in the division is not effective, then you prepare and give to drink to the patient three times the decoction of wormwood; and place a cautery on his head, and cauteryize with a medium-sized cautery over an olive branch.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then sear that spot with a pointed cautery on both supraorbital areas, leaving the hair a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And guard that the artery not be burned there.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the pointed cautery, this is its form.
Capitol .xv.	Capitol. XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the cautery for the softening of the eyelids of the foot.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the foot is softened due to gout or humidity, then sear that eyelid with a cautery like this lunar one; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, sear that spot on both supraorbital areas a little with two cautery points entirely, and let them be long from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the supraorbital area.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to the amount that the free edge of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	When the skin is converted to the inner parts and hand of the eyelid, use a cautery.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eyelid is converted to the inner parts, I must probe the eyelid. The cautery in such cases should be used according to two methods: either by applying a hot cautery or by using a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is hot, command the patient to look away from where the skin is burned as if they were gazing at those who clean their skin, keeping it prolonged and equal. And when probing, you should grasp its root; then strengthen the eyelids with a bandage so that it does not stick until the skin has grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, when they have grown and equalized, place the head of the patient's probe in their temple, and then press over the eyelid of the affected side, marking it with a mark shaped like the leaf of a laurel, which will be the beginning of the mark relative to the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place something hot in a bag or on a poultice over the affected area.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then heat the cautery, of which this is the form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure which is marked, little by little, in stages, while the surface of the wound, which is like a bay leaf, is being burned entirely appropriately.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of recovery from your work is that you see the eyelid of the affected area already contracted and the skin around it elevated due to the puncture of the wound.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it there for three days, and then place it over the wound between the burns to allow the scar to heal.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if for some cause the skin returns to the area near its origin and the eyelid becomes softened, then make another pass with the cautery over that area as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin is on the eyelid, then cauterize it there where it is elevated to its natural place and make it equal so that the skin does not remain uneven.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery for medical burning commands the patient to extend the skin where it is to be made equal, and then make the shape of a mulberry leaf from linen cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take a known soap and fresh fat, one pound or as much as is needed, and mix these fats well, preparing it without rubbing; then spread this mixture over the linen cloth which is made thus in the shape of a mulberry leaf, and place that on the skin or both; place the remaining part cut into small pieces in honey, and position the patient's head at the center.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place that on the medicine and press it slightly so that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for the bite is like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And thus, when you observe that the inflammation is biting, then remove the medicine and press it at the center; as soon as the biting ceases, replace the medicine and wash the area with water; then consider if the eyelid has already been lifted, and if so, apply heat or incision, for then it is good; if not, return to applying the medicine in the place where it did not bite, ensuring that your operation remains equal and contracts the area.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place your hand over the groin area between which the root of the adhesion is to be removed, and cure that with an ointment or something else in which it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must, with due diligence, ensure that no error in the medicine occurs during your operation. If the eyelid becomes softened or some cause of skin swelling appears on it within a few days, then repeat your medication on that place where the eyelid has become softened, and proceed in this manner as you did at the beginning, and soon let it heal completely.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the way to treat a cataract.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyelids of humans are diverse in size and shape, and therefore your incision should be made according to this.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of making the incision should not be hidden from him who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula in the lacrimal duct of the eyelid.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have said in the divisions of the ailments and do not apply your treatment, then when you cauterize it according to this manner: command the patient to place his head on your thigh, and let another minister hold the head of the patient between your knees in such a way that it is neither hurt nor agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place the hot iron on the flesh in the thigh or over the swelling of the boil above the hip.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery, and this is its form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be cylindrical, as is the form of a cane or a bird's feather quill, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, let it penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, let it be drawn out like a needle.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	Yet, however, that which is concave is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is opened, and draw from it clean and dry that which comes out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the well-ignited cautery over it, and hold your hand a little below the root of the nose to prevent your hand or the patient from moving, and then place the cautery on the cheeks and destroy that area.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if at the beginning of your cautery it goes into the mouth, that is good; otherwise, then reapply the cautery one or two more times if necessary; and leave it like this for three days, and then place a border around the area and apply an ointment that is dry until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if it does not heal after ten days, then apply the sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is revealed and is scraped as you see fit in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another method of cautery for a fistula, which some first doctors will say: locate the place of the fistula and do it there and immediately pause at that fissure like a thin form of it. Then put in there the quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and hold your hand like well retained, so that the bad humor does not enter the hole where the melted lead does not penetrate; and continue to pause over the hole of the bad humor as in album of hoot or water, for lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by a marvelous cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed as we have said of the cautery and the cure, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a draft from the nose and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose according to what will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery for the fissure of the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Warts often cause fissures in the lips, and especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Then when you cure those fractures as we have said in the divisions and your cure does not improve, then heat the small surgical cautery according to this form that is taught:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	Let the cavity of the wound be according to the subtlety of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that hot instrument in the fractures until the cautery reaches the depth of the fractures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that with cerote until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery treatment of fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth an abscess forms, and then breaks, becomes old, and forms a fistula, and your cure does not improve, then heat the cautery according to the quantity received in the fistula, place that heated cautery into the tract of the fistula, and keep your hand there until the hot iron reaches its depth, and do this one or two times; then cure that with what we have said about the cure until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the abscess is incised and healed, that is good; otherwise, it is necessary to uncover the area and set the corrupted bone as will be described in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	capitol.xx.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of the cautery treatment of teeth and the softening of arteries.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the arteries are softened by humidity and the teeth are decaying, and you have treated those with medicines without success, then place the patient's head in warm water, and shortly thereafter heat the cautery to the form of which will be described below. Try to hold the cautery over the tooth while inserting it into the area, ensuring that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth so that the warmth reaches the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and repeatedly apply the cautery several times as you see fit.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then the patient should rinse their mouth with salt water and keep it there for an hour, then spit it out, as the decayed tooth is sealed, the softened gum is tightened, and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cautery for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to inflammation or there is a boil or abscess, and medical treatment does not bring relief, the cautery in that area can be performed in two ways: either with a bull's gallbladder cautery or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	The bull's gallbladder cautery is when you take the gallbladder of a bull and fill it with hot oil, then wrap this around the end of the lancet, and immerse the filled gallbladder in hot oil, placing it over the painful tooth rapidly before the oil cools.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeatedly apply it several times before the heat of the fire permeates the pulp of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you do, soak some wool or cloth in the bull's gallbladder mentioned above, and place this over the painful tooth. Then hold the ignited iron over it until the heat reaches the root of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	Moreover, however, the cautery with fire is such that you attend to the small opening of skin or iron, and in its core there must be some coarse material so that the sharpness of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then shape the cautery as it will appear, and place that part over the tooth and put your hand inside to ensure the cautery is well lubricated; and do this a few times to prevent the pain from worsening on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that through the impression of that cautery, the patient opens their mouth wide and maintains it for about an hour; and this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize where you wish to stop according to what is possible.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the catheter:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of exostoses.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are caused by phlegm and humors that are not obedient to digestion through medicines, and you see the digestion of those lightly, then you apply the cautery to cover the form of which this follows, having two ends open so that you let the smoke issue from one end and the other, and place that ignited over that abscess for one minute, and another if you feel it necessary before it reaches the root of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.
